pullRequest.body:
This is a step towards a concrete category redesign, as outlined in this Zulip post: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Concrete.20category.20class.20redesign/near/493903980

This PR updates the category definitions of `TopCat` and some of its descendants to match the new `ConcreteCategory` style:

* Package objects and homs into structures.
* Replace `HasForget` with `ConcreteCategory`.
* Set up a good @[simp] set.
* Ensure constructors and projections are reducible.

I found many places where proofs could be cleaned up, even without looking particularly hard. üéâ Once all the concrete category instances are in we can get rid of even more workarounds.

---
